annotation: <data-piece><history><entry><input>tar -cvf archive.tar /home/user</input><output>archive.tar</output><annotation>Goal: Create a compressed archive of the `/home/user` directory.</annotation><annotation>Subgoal: Ensure that all files in the directory are archived into a `.tar` file.</annotation><annotation>Tools: `tar`</annotation></entry><entry><input>gzip archive.tar</input><output>archive.tar.gz</output><annotation>Goal: Compress the `.tar` archive using `gzip`.</annotation><annotation>Subgoal: Ensure that the `.tar` file is compressed into a `.tar.gz` file.</annotation><annotation>Tools: `gzip`</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls</input><output>archive.tar.gz</output><annotation>Goal: Verify that the compressed archive exists.</annotation><annotation>Subgoal: Ensure the file `archive.tar.gz` is present in the directory.</annotation><annotation>Tools: `ls`</annotation></entry></history><current-entry><entry><input>exit</input><output>exit</output><annotation>Goal: End the session after working with the archive files.</annotation><annotation></annotation><annotation>Tools: `exit`</annotation></entry></current-entry></data-piece>
